intro: Palaquium paucivenosum, commonly known as the rare or lesser-veined palaquium, is a species of flowering plant in the Sapotaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with sparse venation. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
